Package io.dimeformat

Class Dime

java.lang.Object
io.dimeformat.Dime
public final class Dime extends Object
Central class that handles a few important settings and constants.

  • Method Details

    • getGracePeriod

      public static long getGracePeriod()
      Returns the set grace period in seconds. This value is used to allow a grace period when comparing and validating dates (issued at and expires at). A value of 2 will allow a grace margin of +/-2 seconds, given a total window of 4 seconds.
      Returns:
      The set grace period in seconds.

    • setGracePeriod

      public static void setGracePeriod​(long period)
      Sets the grace period, in seconds, that is used to allow for a grace period when comparing and validating dates (issued at and expires at). A value of 2 will allow a grace margin of +/-2 seconds, given a total window of 4 seconds.
      Parameters:
      period - The grace period to set, in seconds.

    • getTimeModifier

      public static long getTimeModifier()
      Get the global time modifier. The modifier is in seconds. If none is set this will return 0.
      Returns:
      The time modifier in use.

    • setTimeModifier

      public static void setTimeModifier​(long modifier)
      Sets the global modifier, in seconds, for all captured timestamps. This may be used in clients with a calculated time different from a server, or network base time. This may be either a positive, or negative number, setting 0 will turn time modification off. Generally it is more recommended that all entities in a network have synced their local time with a common time-server. Servers, with multiple clients, should not use this.
      Parameters:
      modifier - Number of seconds to modify timestamps with.

    • setOverrideTime

      public static void setOverrideTime​(Instant time)
      This method will override the internal time with a provided time. This time is used to verify any timestamps and overriding this should be used carefully and never in a production environment. Set to null, to use current system time (default).
      Parameters:
      time - The time to set, may be null.
